name: Requirement gathering
description: The students start with a brief similar to a real interview coding test. They analyze it by extracting and classifying the information.

name: Project spreadsheet
description: Allows to organize the information in tables. Like isolating the requirements in one page and building a SCRUM Product Backlog in another.

name: User flow diagram
description: This diagram allows the students to understand how the app behave and helps catching missing requirements.

name: Design mockup
description: They use Figma, a professional UI/UX tool to build an interactive mockup, to test how the web app must look and behave before coding.

name: Component tree
description: This diagram helps the students visualize the architecture of the app, it creates a model similar to how a tourist uses a map to familiarize with a new city.

name: Coding stage
description: Here is when they start the coding process. By now they have a clear understanding of what solution to build.

name: Post coding stage
description: When they publish the website on real a host and make improvements based on users feedback.
